entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 9:36PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS, WET SNOW AND RAIN FOR COLD BAY AND KING COVE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... A strong front will move over the Southern Alaska Peninsula tonight bringing a mix of wet snow, strong winds and rain. The increase in winds is ongoing, with gusts by 9pm ranging from 55 to 65 mph. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 3:14PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF DENSE FOG FOR THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MATANUSKA VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT... Areas of dense fog has developed north of Birchwood into the Matanuska valley and westward towards Willow with visibilities reduced to one-quarter mile at times. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Sudden

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 1:59PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Windy With Blowing Snow Over Highway Summits This Weekend.. East winds gusting to 40 mph are expected to develop Friday night over Steese and Dalton Highway Summits, continuing through Saturday night. This could cause blowing snow over Highway Summits, and could cause travel to be difficult due to low visibility and drifting snow.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 9:14PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The St. Johns River at Astor is expected to fluctuate between Minor Flood Stage and Action Stage through early next week. The river is forecast to continue a very slow decline, but winds could cause occasional rises.
